extendedIngredients.name: parsley leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup firmly packed fresh parsley leaves

title: Citrus-Walnut Salad
summary: Citrus-Walnut Salad might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 8 and costs $1.77 per serving. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, primal, and fodmap friendly recipe has 100 calories, 3g of protein, and 5g of fat per serving. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 30 minutes. A mixture of firmly parsley leaves, cumin-dijon vinaigrette, grapefruits, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 81%. This score is great. Similar recipes include Grilled Leek and Radicchio Salad with Citrus-Walnut Vinaigrette, Orange Glow Muffins. Citrus. Spicy Ginger. Walnut, and Citrus Salad.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350. Bake walnuts in a single layer in a shallow pan 6 to 8 minutes or until toasted and fragrant, stirring halfway through.                                                                                                 Remove and discard outer leaves of endive. Rinse endive with cold water, and pat dry. Cut each endive head diagonally into 1/4-inch-thick slices, and place in a serving bowl. Add walnuts, parsley leaves, and desired amount of dressing; gently toss to coat. Top with grapefruit. Serve with any remaining dressing.

steps.step: Bake walnuts in a single layer in a shallow pan 6 to 8 minutes or until toasted and fragrant, stirring halfway through.
Remove and discard outer leaves of endive. Rinse endive with cold water, and pat dry.
Cut each endive head diagonally into 1/4-inch-thick slices, and place in a serving bowl.
Add walnuts, parsley leaves, and desired amount of dressing; gently toss to coat. Top with grapefruit.
